editor.title: How are my changes saved?
editor.body: Any changes you make will be saved automatically.

editor.type.scene3d.title: How can I move the camera?
editor.type.scene3d.body:
Rotate the camera by clicking and holding the left mouse button on the scene and moving the mouse.
While holding the left mouse button down, move the camera with WASD or the arrow keys.
Click and hold the right mouse button to roll the camera.

editor.type.scene3d.title: How do I record camera animations?
editor.type.scene3d.body: Click on the Camera tab in the top left and create a new path to start recording. Use the timeline that appears on the bottom of the preview window to create your path. You can also adjust the duration of your path on the right.

editor.type.scene3d.title: How do I import a model?
editor.type.scene3d.body: Click on Edit and Import Model and choose an .fbx or .obj file to import. Make sure all required textures are in the same directory and in .tga or .png format.

editor.type.scene3d.title: How can I update my model after doing some changes?
editor.type.scene3d.body: Simply re-import the model without altering its name. All instances in your scene will be updated accordingly.

editor.type.scene3d.title: How do I place my model multiple times in the scene?
editor.type.scene3d.body: Drag and drop your model from the Asset view on the bottom into the Scene Graph on the left.

editor.type.scene3d.title: How can I move my model?
editor.type.scene3d.body: First, select your model in the Scene Graph and then choose one of the gizmos in the top left to translate, rotate or scale your model.

editor.type.scene3d.title: How can I tweak my model and its materials?
editor.type.scene3d.body: Select your model in the Scene Graph and subsequently tweak its (material) properties on the right, in the Properties view.

editor.type.scene3d.title: Why does my model have a dull color?
editor.type.scene3d.body: Make sure to put lights into your scene to light your model properly. Add a light by clicking on Edit and Add light.

editor.type.scene2d.title: How can I move the camera?
editor.type.scene2d.body: You can pan the camera by clicking and holding the left mouse button on the scene and moving the mouse. Scrolling the mouse wheel will zoom the view.

editor.type.scene2d.title: How do I import an image?
editor.type.scene2d.body: Click on Edit and Import Image and choose a .tga or .png file to import. It will be added to the scene automatically.

editor.type.scene2d.title: How can I update my image after changing it outside the editor?
editor.type.scene2d.body: Simply re-import the image without altering its name. All instances in your scene will be updated accordingly.

editor.type.scene2d.title: How can I move my image?
editor.type.scene2d.body: First, select your image in the Scene Graph and then choose one of the gizmos in the top left to translate, rotate or scale your image.

editor.type.scene2d.title: How can I tweak my image and its materials?
editor.type.scene2d.body: Select your image in the Scene Graph and subsequently tweak its (material) properties on the right, in the Properties view.

editor.editorWelcome.title: Which wallpaper type should I choose?
editor.editorWelcome.body:
Scene: create a dynamic 3D or 2D wallpaper by importing your own models and textures.
Video: create a wallpaper from a video file.
Web: import a website as a wallpaper.
Application: import an application (like a Unity game) and turn it into a wallpaper.

editor.editorWelcome.scene.title: What are the differences between 3D and 2D scenes?
editor.editorWelcome.scene.body: 3D scenes allow you to import models (.fbx and .obj files) while 2D scenes only require you to import textures as 2D image layers (.tga and .png files). You will need some experience with Maya, 3DS Max, Modo or alike to create a 3D scene.

editor.editorWelcome.video.title: Which requirements do I need to fulfill for a video wallpaper?
editor.editorWelcome.video.body: You only need to import a single video file. Click on Import to get started. Videos using the H.264 codec and mp4 as container format are recommended.

editor.editorWelcome.web.title: How do I create a web wallpaper?
editor.editorWelcome.web.body: You will need to supply a directory that contains an index.html and all additional dependencies you need. The entire directory will be copied and the index.html will be loaded automatically to open the wallpaper.

editor.editorWelcome.application.title: How do I create an application wallpaper?
editor.editorWelcome.application.body: You need to supply a directory with an executable file (.exe). Unity projects are recommended. The executable will be started automatically as your wallpaper.

editor.editorSteamPublish.title: Which tags are allowed?
editor.editorSteamPublish.body: You may only enter tags that appear in the autocomplete box when you start typing.

editor.editorSteamPublish.title: How do I add additional screenshots or videos to my item?
editor.editorSteamPublish.body: After publishing the item to Steam Workshop, you can further edit it in Steam and add additional content.
